intro: Pera polylepis subsp. polylepis, commonly known as the Yungas evergreen oak, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to the humid montane forests of the Eastern Andes in Bolivia and northern Argentina. This subspecies is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive, leathery leaves. It typically grows in well-drained soils at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
